result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Naomi Garland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Huber for work and treatment.
The Court ordered a review by the mental health unit.

miscConds.notes:
**Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).**

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
Firearms warning given. Voting admonishment given.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims:  Joshua E. Fritz T. Home Depot Stores located in Metro Milwaukee, including: Racine, Waukesha, Kenosha, Sheboygan.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
2/3/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional privileges is denied, filed and signed by the Court.  Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se letter request for huber release for child care.

Defendant Jessica Naomi Garland in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

AS TO EACH COUNT:
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

The Court ordered a review by the mental health unit.

*As a condition of probation the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Joshua E. Fritz T. Home Depot Stores located in Metro Milwaukee, including: Racine, Waukesha, Kenosha, Sheboygan.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Jessica Naomi Garland in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.    

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1, 2, 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.     Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed, Count 1:  Theft, contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) Wis Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor. Count 2:  Carrying a Concealed Weapon, contrary to sec. 941.23(2), 939.51(3)(a) Wis Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.  Count 3: Misdemeanor Battery contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a) Wis Stats. a Class A Misdemeanor.
